column4: does anyone here have a lenovo thinkpad edge 11 with the newest bios and tell me how he/she did it? I am trying to fool around with grub4dos and its not pleasent
pleasant*
grub is easy if you have another partition
how many do you have?
I have one USB disk
usb thumbdrive that it
is*
doesn't grub pick up the internal disc then?
I have nothing installed on the internal disk, I want grub to boot the update bios iso
cant you just change the boot order to cd first?
I have no cd drive (nor external)
thats why I am playing around with grub4dos
oh, sorry!
don't worry, I am probaby being short spoken because I am annoyed by this problem xD
maybe there is a generic guide you can follow for this, non ubuntu related on how to make a cd boot off a usb stick (separate one) ?
otherwise you can make a dos boot usb with the app and bios files
yeah, thats what I tried
what happened?
grub4dos booted from my usb drive, but didn't boot my BOOT.iso (with the BIOS update)
never done this but it sounds plausable
what format is the usb stick?
vfat
